author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...ERIN RE-INTENSIFIES INTO A CATEGORY 4 HURRICANE AFTER COMPLETING AN EYEWALL REPLACEMENT CYCLE... ...LIFE-THREATENING SURF AND RIP CURRENTS LIKELY ACROSS THE U.S. EASTERN SEABOARD AS ERIN BECOMES A VERY LARGE HURRICANE THIS WEEK...
summary: ...ERIN RE-INTENSIFIES INTO A CATEGORY 4 HURRICANE AFTER COMPLETING AN EYEWALL REPLACEMENT CYCLE... ...LIFE-THREATENING SURF AND RIP CURRENTS LIKELY ACROSS THE U.S. EASTERN SEABOARD AS ERIN BECOMES A VERY LARGE HURRICANE THIS WEEK... As of 11:00 PM AST Sun Aug 17 the center of Erin was located near 22.3, -69.3 with movement NW at 12 mph. The minimum central pressure was 942 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 130 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...ERIN RE-INTENSIFIES INTO A CATEGORY 4 HURRICANE AFTER COMPLETING AN EYEWALL REPLACEMENT CYCLE... ...LIFE-THREATENING SURF AND RIP CURRENTS LIKELY ACROSS THE U.S. EASTERN SEABOARD AS ERIN BECOMES A VERY LARGE HURRICANE THIS WEEK... As of 11:00 PM AST Sun Aug 17 the center of Erin was located near 22.3, -69.3 with movement NW at 12 mph. The minimum central pressure was 942 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 130 mph.

title: Summary - Hurricane Erin (AT5/AL052025)
